name: Silent Push
description: This connector integrates with the Silent Push system to gain insights into domain/IP information, reputations, enrichment, and infratag related details. It also provides functionality to live-scan URLs and take screenshots of them. Additionally, it allows fetching future attack feeds from the Silent Push system

actions.description: Initiate a connection to the Silent Push system to validate the asset configuration
Get domain information along with Silent Push risk score and live whois information for multiple domains

fetch_risk_score.description: Fetch the Silent Push risk score for domains

fetch_whois_info.description: Fetch the live whois information for domains

actions.description: Get certificate data collected from domain scanning

domain_regex.description: A RE2 regular expression pattern to match domains. Overrides the domain parameter

certificate_issuer.description: The name of the certificate issuer. Wildcards (*) are supported

date_min.description: Filters certificates issued on or after the specified date (yyyy-mm-dd format)

date_max.description: Filters certificates issued on or before the specified date (yyyy-mm-dd format)

prefer.description: Prefer to wait for results for longer running queries or to return job_id immediately (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

max_wait.description: Number of seconds to wait for results before returning a job_id, with a range from 0 to 25 seconds (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

with_metadata.description: Includes a metadata object in the response, containing returned results, total results, and job_id

limit.description: Number of results to return (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

example_values: {'C': None, 'CN': '*.rainier.playground.scs.silentpush.com', 'L': None, 'O': None, 'OU': None, 'ST': None, 'aggregated': '/CN=*.rainier.playground.scs.silentpush.com', 'emailAddress': None}

actions.description: Search for domains with optional filters

domain.description: Name or wildcard pattern of domain names to search for

domain_regex.description: A valid re2 regular expression to match domains to be searched. This parameter overrides the domain parameter

name_server.description: Name server name or wildcard pattern of name server used by domains

asname.description: Search all AS numbers where the AS Name begins with 'as name'

min_ip_diversity.description: Filter records according to minimum ip diversity limit

registrar.description: Name or partial name of registrar used to register domains - no wildcards, the given string is used in partial match - this is a slow search option and should only be used in combination with the domain match option

min_asn_diversity.description: Filter records according to minimum asn diversity limit

certificate_issuer.description: Filter applied to get domains that have had ssl certificates issued using the named certificate issuer - wildcards are supported

whois_date_after.description: Filter domains that have a whois created date after this date (yyyy-mm-dd format)

limit.description: Number of results to return (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

actions.description: Get infratags for multiple domains with optional clustering
actions.verbose: Retrieve infratags for specified domains. It allows querying infratags based on live lookup data or PADNS data, and provides options for handling self-hosted infrastructure <self|full>. Additionally, it allows specifying a timestamp to retrieve infratags based on PADNS data within a specific time range. It accepts dates in yyyy-mm-dd format, epochs in number format, or seconds in negative number format for relative time. The "clusters" parameter enables grouping the infratags into clusters for further analysis.

match.description: To configure self-hosted infrastructure: Choose 'full' to tag them with the domain name or 'self' to label NS and MX records (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

mode.description: Whether to build infratag from live lookup data or from previously collected PADNS data (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

as_of.description: Specifies the timestamp for fetching infratags based on PADNS data. Please note: The value of the `mode` parameter will be ignored, defaulting to 'PADNS'

clusters.description: Whether to build clusters of domains based on tag similarity

actions.description: Retrieve comprehensive enrichment information for a given resource (domain, IPv4, or IPv6)
actions.verbose: The action provides a wealth of enrichment information for a specified `resource`. it can be a domain, IPv4, or IPv6 address. This includes a variety of indicators such as DGA probability, Alexa rank, and dynamic domain indicators, alongside URL shortener usage, essential domain details like registration dates and registrar data, and security warning flags for open directories, expired certificates, or open S3 buckets. It also encompasses IP & ASN diversity scores, listing scores, nameserver reputation data, server changes, and a comprehensive Silent Push risk score for Domain. For IPv4 and IPv6 addresses, include ASN-related reputational scores, subnet information, IP density metrics, reputational scoring, expired certificates, open directories, geolocation details, and a Silent Push risk score tailored for IPs. This single action aggregates a multifaceted set of data points to deliver a deep, nuanced view of a resource's online presence and security profile, equipping users with critical insights for cybersecurity analysis and threat intelligence.

resource.description: Type of resource for which information needs to be retrieved

value.description: Value corresponding to the selected 'resource' for which information needs to be retrieved

explain.description: Show the information used to calculate the reputation score

scan_data.description: Whether to show details of data collected from host, ipv4 or ipv6 scanning based on the input of `resource` parameter

example_values: private, max-age=0, no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0

actions.description: Get IP information for multiple IPv4s and IPv6s

ips.description: IPv4 or IPv6 address to fetch information of IPs(comma-separated)

actions.description: Retrieve the reputation information for an Autonomous System Number (ASN)
actions.verbose: Retrieve the takedown reputation history for a given ASN. ASN reputation scores are a measure of the trustworthiness and reputation of the networks associated with a particular ASN.

asn.description: ASN number for which information needs to be retrieve

explain.description: Show the information used to calculate the reputation score

limit.description: The maximum number of reputation history to retrieve (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

actions.description: Retrieve the takedown reputation information for an Autonomous System Number (ASN)
actions.verbose: Return the takedown reputation information for an ASN. An ASN's takedown reputation is a measure of the ability and willingness of a network's service provider to take action to mitigate cyber threats associated with the network's services.

asn.description: ASN number for which information needs to be retrieve

explain.description: Show the information used to calculate the reputation score

limit.description: The maximum number of reputation history to retrieve (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

actions.description: Retrieve the reputation information for an IPv4
actions.verbose: Retrieve the reputation information for an IPv4. An IPv4 address' reputation score is a measure of the trustworthiness and reputation of an individual IPv4 address.

ipv4.description: IPv4 address for which information needs to be retrieve

explain.description: Show the information used to calculate the reputation score

limit.description: The maximum number of reputation history to retrieve (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

actions.description: Retrieve status of running job or results from completed job
actions.verbose: Fetch the status or results of a specified job using the job ID. It also provides optional parameters like 'max_wait' to allow customization of the wait time for results and 'result_type' to include details in the response, including options for 'Status', 'Include Metadata', and 'Exclude Metadata'. 'Status' allows users to specify whether to receive only job status, even if the result is available. 'Include Metadata' ensures metadata inclusion in results, overriding the original request if necessary. Conversely, 'Exclude Metadata' guarantees metadata omission from results, disregarding any metadata-inclusive original requests.

job_id.description: ID of the job returned by Silent Push actions

max_wait.description: Number of seconds to wait for results before returning a job_id, with a range from 0 to 25 seconds (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

result_type.description: Type of result to include in the response

example_values: {'C': None, 'CN': '*.rainier.playground.scs.silentpush.com', 'L': None, 'O': None, 'OU': None, 'ST': None, 'aggregated': '/CN=*.rainier.playground.scs.silentpush.com', 'emailAddress': None}

actions.description: Retrieve the reputation information for an nameserver
actions.verbose: Retrieve historical reputation data for the specified name server, including the reputation score and, optionally, the details used to calculate this score. The 'nameserver' parameter specifies the target name server, the 'limit' parameter specifies the number of results to return, and the 'explain' parameter determines whether to include the calculation details.

nameserver.description: Nameserver name for which information needs to be retrieve

explain.description: Show the information used to calculate the reputation score

limit.description: The maximum number of reputation history to retrieve (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

actions.description: Retrieve the reputation information for subnet
actions.verbose: Fetch a list of IPv4 subnets ranked by their reputation scores, which reflect the trustworthiness and security level of the subnets. It includes the option to specify the number of results to return with the 'limit' parameter and to retrieve in-depth details used to calculate the reputation scores with the 'explain' parameter. When 'explain' is set to 1, the response will include information such as the number of active IPs within the subnet, the number of listed IPs, and the allocation age of the subnet.

subnet.description: IPv4 subnet for which information needs to be retrieved. For example, 192.1.0.0/24

explain.description: Show the information used to calculate the reputation score

limit.description: The maximum number of reputation history to retrieve (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

actions.description: Retrieve the takedown reputation information for an Autonomous System Number (ASN)
actions.verbose: Retrieve a list of Autonomous System Numbers (ASNs) associated with A records for the specified domain name, including any subdomains, observed within the last 30 days. The action provides insights into the network infrastructure used by the domain, which can be useful for tracking hosting patterns or changes in domain configuration.

domain.description: Name of domain to search asns for

example_values: Successfully fetched ASNs seen for the domain

actions.description: Forward PADNS lookup
actions.verbose:
Scan through Silent Push's passive DNS data and obtain information based on various parameters. The first_seen_after, first_seen_before, last_seen_before, last_seen_after and as_of parameters have the following time input options:
  • fixed date: yyyy-mm-dd (2021-07-09)
  • fixed time in epoch format: number (1625834953)
  • relative time seconds ago: negative number (-172800)
  • relative fixed time period ago: negative number with time period (-36h / -5d / -3w / -6m) h: hours, d: days, w: weeks, m: months
.

qname.description: The DNS record name to lookup, wildcards are supported in name string

netmask.description: The netmask may be given for DNS record types ptr4 and ptr6

subdomains.description: Whether to include or exclude subdomains from DNS record type a or aaaa

regex.description: Regular expression match for domain/host. It overrides DNS record name parameter and it must be valid re2 regular expression

match.description: Whether to limit results to self-hosted infrastructure for qtype MX or NS - strict or find all matching results - self; this only show results where MX or NS records are in the same domain as qname (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

first_seen_after.description: The first_seen timestamp must be on or after this time

first_seen_before.description: The first_seen timestamp must be on or before this time

last_seen_after.description: The last_seen timestamp must be on or after this time

last_seen_before.description: The last_seen timestamp must be on or before this time

as_of.description: Return results where the as_of timestamp equivalent is between the first_seen and the last_seen timestamp of record

sort.description: Return results in specified order(asc or desc) according to columns: column/order (comma-separated)

output_format.description: Whether to use Silent Push padns output format or cof (common output format) (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

prefer.description: Prefer to wait for results for longer running queries or to return job_id immediately (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

with_metadata.description: Includes a metadata object in the response, containing returned results, total results, and job_id

max_wait.description: Number of seconds to wait for results before returning a job_id, with a range from 0 to 25 seconds (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

limit.description: Number of results to return (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

actions.description: Reverse PADNS lookup
actions.verbose:
Scan through Silent Push's passive DNS data and obtain information based on various parameters. The first_seen_after, first_seen_before, last_seen_before, last_seen_after and as_of parameters have the following time input options:
  • fixed date: yyyy-mm-dd (2021-07-09)
  • fixed time in epoch format: number (1625834953)
  • relative time seconds ago: negative number (-172800)
  • relative fixed time period ago: negative number with time period (-36h / -5d / -3w / -6m) h: hours, d: days, w: weeks, m: months
.

qname.description: The DNS record name to lookup, wildcards are supported in name string

netmask.description: The netmask may be given for DNS record types ptr4 and ptr6

subdomains.description: Whether to include or exclude subdomains from DNS record type a or aaaa

regex.description: Regular expression match for domain/host. It overrides DNS record name parameter and it must be valid re2 regular expression

first_seen_after.description: The first_seen timestamp must be on or after this time

first_seen_before.description: The first_seen timestamp must be on or before this time

last_seen_after.description: The last_seen timestamp must be on or after this time

last_seen_before.description: The last_seen timestamp must be on or before this time

as_of.description: Return results where the as_of timestamp equivalent is between the first_seen and the last_seen timestamp of record

sort.description: Return results in specified order(asc or desc) according to columns: column/order (comma-separated)

output_format.description: Whether to use Silent Push padns output format or cof (common output format) (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

prefer.description: Prefer to wait for results for longer running queries or to return job_id immediately (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

with_metadata.description: Includes a metadata object in the response, containing returned results, total results, and job_id

max_wait.description: Number of seconds to wait for results before returning a job_id, with a range from 0 to 25 seconds (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

limit.description: Number of results to return (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

actions.description: Get information based on numerous granular DNS/IP parameters
actions.verbose: Retrieve domain density based on qtype and query. Required query types include nssrv, mxsrv, ipv4, ipv6, and asn. Optional scope parameter allows for exact or near match results based on the qtype. For ipv4, specify ip, subnet, subnet_ips, asn, or asn_subnets. For asn, choose asn or asn_subnets. For nssrv or mxsrv, select host, domain, or subdomain. For chv, select chv or chv_analysis based on the query.

qtype.description: Query type from one of nssrv, mxsrv, nshash, mxhash, ipv4, ipv6, asn and chv

query.description: Specify a value to lookup, name of NS or MX server, hash of NS or MX server, IPv4 or IPv6 address, AS number

scope.description: Retrieve exact/near match results by query type: ipv4: ip-subnet/subnet_ips-asn/asn_subnets, ASN: asn-asn_subnets, nssrv or mxsrv: host-domain-subdomain, chv: chv/chv_analysis

actions.description: Search the Silent Push scan data repositories

limit.description: Number of results to return (Defaults to Silent Push API's behaviour)

with_metadata.description: Includes a metadata object in the response, containing returned results, total results, and job_id

query.description: Query in SPQL syntax to scan data

fields.description: Fields to return in the scanned data fetched using query (comma-separated)

sort.description: Sort according to fields from the Silent Push supported field names, followed by forward slash (/), and the sort order (asc or desc)(comma-separated)

example_values: Silent Push | Domain, IP and URL Data to Find Indicators of Future Attack
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:109) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/112.0

actions.description: Scan a URL to get metadata on what it is hosted
actions.verbose: Retrieve hosting metadata by scanning a provided URL. Parameters include URL, platform (Desktop, Mobile, Crawler), OS (Windows, Linux, MacOS, iOS, Android), browser (Firefox, Chrome, Edge, Safari), and region (US, EU, AS, TOR) .

platform.description: Device to perform scan with (Desktop, Mobile, Crawler)

os.description: OS to perform scan with (Windows, Linux, MacOS, iOS, Android)

browser.description: Browser to perform scan with (Firefox, Chrome, Edge, Safari)

region.description: Region from where scan should be perform (US, EU, AS, TOR)

example_values: Splunk | The Key to Enterprise Resilience
DigiCert Global G2 TLS RSA SHA256 2020 CA1
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:109) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/112.0
CP="This is not a P3P policy! See g.co/p3phelp for more info."

1P_JAR=2024-04-24-08; expires=Fri, 24-May-2024 08:37:47 GMT; path=/; domain=.google.com; Secure; SameSite=none, NID=513=TfgCcEFmO67FPZZo77RYaVDwoRenM13CrcTPgG0r1o3ozINX2GN4a1SnmIRnrB2XqBUIVE7i0H7OnfdTwSDvphXxpwOOuAxG_KuLtXU5VHRTZXCSfPAL_0QGw7SlmKdLCC4-mGsr8tNtrI-cTzgj_JMbD025bzUq6wQh0MLeq9U; expires=Thu, 24-Oct-2024 08:37:46 GMT; path=/; domain=.google.com; Secure; HttpOnly; SameSite=none
Sec-CH-UA-Platform, Sec-CH-UA-Platform-Version, Sec-CH-UA-Full-Version, Sec-CH-UA-Arch, Sec-CH-UA-Model, Sec-CH-UA-Bitness, Sec-CH-UA-Full-Version-List, Sec-CH-UA-WoW64
Successfully scanned data from live URL

actions.action: get indicators of future attack feed
actions.description: Get indicators of future attack feed from the Silent Push platform
actions.verbose: This action connects to the Silent Push system to query for potential future attacks, utilizing a feed UUID for data filtering. Additionally, it supports pagination through parameters page_no and page_size. For instance, if the total records are 600 and the page size is set to 200, it will create three pages, and setting page_no to 2 will return records from 201 to 400.

feed_uuid.description: Feed unique id to fetch records for

page_no.description: Indicates the specific page to fetch (default: 1)

page_size.description: Determines the number of records per page (default: 10,000)

actions.description: This action generate a screenshot for a URL and store it inside the vault

example_values: Successfully fetched screenshot from live URL

actions.description: Get data for Organisation feeds and download as csv file in vault
actions.verbose: The Feed URL can be obtained from the Silent Push platform. Go to Data Export > Organization Exports then for a specific feed select Automate Export and click on 'Copy API Endpoint' to get the feed URL.
